body_content.explanation: physical activity that you do to make your body strong and healthy:
examples: Swimming is my favourite form of exercise.
You really should take more exercise.
I do stomach exercises most days.

body_content.explanation: an action or actions intended to improve something or make something happen:
examples: Ships from eight navies will be taking part in an exercise in the Pacific to improve their efficiency in combat.
It would be a useful exercise for you to say the speech aloud several times.

body_content.explanation: a short piece of written work that you do to practise something you are learning:
examples: The book has exercises at the end of every chapter.
The exercise of restraint may well be difficult.

body_content.explanation: a ceremony that includes speeches and usually traditional music or activities:
to do physical activities to make your body strong and healthy:
examples: She exercises most evenings usually by running.
A work-out in the gym will exercise all the major muscle groups.

body_content.explanation: If you exercise an animal, you make it walk or run so that it stays strong and healthy:
examples: Now he's retired he spends most afternoons exercising his dogs.
I exercised my democratic right by not voting in the election.
Always exercise caution when handling radioactive substances.
We've decided to exercise the option (= use the part of a legal agreement) to buy the house we now lease.
